name: Half-Life
description: Unimatrix Zero has returned, and the new individuals being pulled into the respite spot for Borg drones are not assimilated. What is the true nature of the new Unimatrix Zero?
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using La Sirena Borg Queen, any version of Six of Ten, Axum, Seven, or Borg will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: La Sirena Borg Queen, Six of Ten, Axum, Seven, or Borg
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Boimler
featured_crew.flavor: Wanting to get the maximum score for the drill, Boimler passed it over and over again, each time saving more and more Borg babies.

featured_crew.name: Axum
featured_crew.flavor: With the help of the Voyager crew, Axum set the Unimatrix Zero drones free, and became leader of the resistance movement against the Borg.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Seven
rewards.flavor: After being severed from the Borg Collective, Seven of Nine--now called Seven--struggled to adapt.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Borg Queen
rewards.flavor: The Borg Queen opts for cunning over brute force in her attempts to control Jurati.

action.name: Betrayal Is An Anagram For “Believe Me”

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: Boimler
rewards.flavor: Wanting to get the maximum score for the drill, Boimler passed it over and over again, each time saving more and more Borg babies.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Boimler
rewards.flavor: Wanting to get the maximum score for the drill, Boimler passed it over and over again, each time saving more and more Borg babies.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

adventures.name: Waking Life
adventures.description: Find a way to pass information to people on the outside.

adventures.name: Wavelengths
adventures.description: Take readings from within Unimatrix Zero.

adventures.name: No Place Like Home
adventures.description: Connect those in the Unimatrix with their real world selves.

adventures.name: REM Refuge
adventures.description: Discover the truth of the new Unimatrix Zero.

rewards.name: Axum
rewards.flavor: With the help of the Voyager crew, Axum set the Unimatrix Zero drones free, and became leader of the resistance movement against the Borg.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Learn who is and isn't an ally with the Klingon Empire.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "Thank you for allowing us to reach out via holo-communicator. I'm able to appear in Unimatrix Zero like this - without my implants - and this is how I wanted you to see me."

"Yes, you heard right. Unimatrix Zero has returned. And though we are all happy to be reunited, something doesn't seem right. The population has ballooned. And though many don't retain their memories, we've gathered enough to suggest most of the new inhabitants aren't drones."

"We are uncertain where they have come from or how they've managed to enter Unimatrix Zero, let alone why it has reappeared. That is why we would like you to bring some of your crew members and aid us in the investigation."
"Thank you for allowing us to reach out via holo-communicator. I'm able to appear in Unimatrix Zero like this - without my implants - and this is how I wanted you to see me."

"Yes, you heard right. Unimatrix Zero has returned. And though we are all happy to be reunited, something doesn't seem right. The population has ballooned. And though many don't retain their memories, we've gathered enough to suggest most of the new inhabitants aren't drones."

"We are uncertain where they have come from or how they've managed to enter Unimatrix Zero, let alone why it has reappeared. That is why we would like you to bring some of your crew members and aid us in the investigation."

"I have managed to pinpoint several of the individuals using the readings provided. As suspected, they are not aboard Borg vessels. Upon further investigation, it seems many of them do have cybernetic implants or other similar augmentations."

responses.text: "What is the relationship between the implants and Unimatrix Zero?"
"How did you manage to find them outside of Unimatrix Zero?"

screens.text: "As I thought. So the implants are a common factor. Most of the individuals I spoke with seem to lose most of their memories between the sleeping and waking world. But a few noted that they have been feeling negative impacts in their waking lives."

"The most common complaint is that they are 'more tired'. A few have reported decreased ability to concentrate, headaches, and eye pain. But the most troubling is that a few have reported hearing voices..."
"We are still uncertain. One would think the implants are connecting them to Unimatrix Zero, but that still leaves far too many questions. How were they identified? How is it reaching them?"
"You don't need to worry, this old general has his ways. ...though some of the information you provided may have made it slightly easier."
"There's still so much we don't know. But I'm hoping you can help us fill in the blanks outside Unimatrix Zero, Captain."

"I have managed to pinpoint several of the individuals using the readings provided. As suspected, they are not aboard Borg vessels. Upon further investigation, it seems many of them do have cybernetic implants or other similar augmentations."

"The most common complaint is that they are 'more tired'. A few have reported decreased ability to concentrate, headaches, and eye pain. But the most troubling is that a few have reported hearing voices..."
"We are still uncertain. One would think the implants are connecting them to Unimatrix Zero, but that still leaves far too many questions. How were they identified? How is it reaching them?"
"You don't need to worry, this old general has his ways. ...though some of the information you provided may have made it slightly easier."
"There's still so much we don't know. But I'm hoping you can help us fill in the blanks outside Unimatrix Zero, Captain."
